question.stem: Which factor will most likely cause a person to develop a fever?

choices.text: a leg muscle relaxing after exercise
choices.label: A

choices.text: a bacterial population in the bloodstream
choices.label: B

choices.text: several viral particles on the skin
choices.label: C

choices.text: carbohydrates being digested in the stomach
choices.label: D

question.stem: Which of the following is an example of liquid water?
Which best describes the speed of a ball as it is thrown straight up into the air and comes back down?

choices.text: The ball goes up at a constant speed, stops, then comes down at a constant speed.
choices.label: A

choices.text: The ball goes up at a constant speed, stops, and increases speed as it comes down.
choices.label: B

choices.text: The ball goes slower and slower as it goes up, stops, and then goes faster and faster as it comes down.
choices.label: C

choices.text: The ball goes slower and slower as it goes up, stops, and then comes down at a constant speed.
choices.label: D

question.stem: Which of the following is a SOURCE of light?
A fold observed in layers of sedimentary rock most likely resulted from the
